result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo Martell Holmes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deangelo Martell Holmes appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Deangelo Martell Holmes.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense to review offer. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing, Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Martell Holmes in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Attorney Plummer appeared late in court.  Defense counsel was given defendant's phone number.  New status conference date selected off the record.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.  Case calendared for a Status Conference on 7-27-2022.
Due to the Judicial Rotation court orderd matter adjourned. New date selected with defense counsel in person. 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Defense to notify his client of the new date and time. This hearing will be held in person.
Status Conference scheduled August 5, 2022 at 3:00pm

Defendant Deangelo Martell Holmes in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for\ status of counsel.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Mattjew Plummer  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $40 Per Month. Repayment to begin 45 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. . Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deangelo Martell Holmes in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/31/2022@2p
